content.description: Make some strenuous pulls with poor feet through the start on beautiful, featured, orange rock. The crux comes at the fourth bolt, when pulling over the roof. Sustained and thoughtful climbing continues above, ending with a steep, reachy move to a big jug.
content.location: This is the rightmost of the three routes where the trail meets the wall. Look for the obvious orange streak in a small corner feature.

content.description:
Climb steep, juggy rock at the start and into a right-leaning crack. Cruxy moves in the middle of the crack and leaving the crack take you to easier terrain and a good stance at the anchor.

Above and left of the anchor is a bolt and another anchor without links or chains. It was originally envisioned to continue, and with some more work and exploration, it will get extended.
content.location: This is the first route on the left, immediately above where the trail meets the wall.

content.description:
Start on steep, pocketed rock and climb sustained, wandering, and thoughtful climbing that requires balance and footwork. You'll find a series of pockets, cracks and features. The finish involves a mantle to a good stance.

The world is a better place when people act out of love, not hate.
content.location: This is the middle of the three routes that are located where the trail meets the wall.
